AI:  Artificial Intelligence (AI) is a technology that allows machines to learn and analyze data without being explicitly programmed. Unsupervised learning is a type of AI where the machine analyzes unlabeled data, looking for patterns and drawing conclusions on its own. This is done by giving the machine access to a large amount of diverse data, such as images of dogs, so it can learn to analyze and make predictions based on the patterns it finds. In the case of unsupervised learning and dogs, the machine increases its "insight" by learning from various images of dogs and eventually being able to predict if a new picture is of a dog, even if it wasn't part of the labeled data set.

AI:  Artificial Intelligence (AI) is a technology that enables machines to analyze data and learn without being explicitly programmed. Two main types of AI are supervised and unsupervised learning. In supervised learning, machines use labeled data to learn and make predictions. In unsupervised learning, they analyze unlabeled data to find patterns and make conclusions. AI applications include smart personal assistants like Siri and Alexa, and Netflix's movie recommendation system. Regarding fears about AI, machines are not yet super-intelligent entities, but heavy regulations and cautions are advised as they continue to evolve. Examples of AI in action today include voice-activated assistants and recommendation systems that learn from user data to provide accurate suggestions.
